This page contains links to Shiny-apps for dendrochronology, but that are not released as a package to install. Some are also listed here: <https://opendendro.org/apps>.

+----------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------+
| ## Name of shiny app | ## Description[^1]                                                                   | ## Links                                                 | ## Github                                        |
+----------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------+
| iDetrend             | A Shiny app for interactively detrending tree-ring data using dplR.                  | [Website](https://viz.datascience.arizona.edu/iDetrend/) | [GitHub](https://github.com/OpenDendro/iDetrend) |
+----------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------+
| treeSong             | A Shiny app for converting the spectral properties of tree-ring data into audio.     |                                                          | [GitHub](https://github.com/OpenDendro/treeSong) |
+----------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------+
| xDateR               | A Shiny app for graphically and statistically crossdating tree-ring data using dplR. | [Website](https://viz.datascience.arizona.edu/xDateR/)   | [GitHub](https://github.com/OpenDendro/xDater)   |
+----------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------+

[^1]: Descriptions are based on the original descriptions by the author(s).
